synopsis.text: Ruka is a young girl who feels a mysterious connection to the ocean. When she was little, she saw a "ghost" in the water at the aquarium where her father works. Now during summer vacation, Ruka's drawn back to the aquarium, where she meets two boys named Umi and Sora. Umi and Sora have an extraordinary upbringing - they were raised by dugongs and have a special bond with the sea. They swim beautifully, almost as if flying through the water. Ruka is captivated by the boys and their swimming. She also hears the same strange calls from the ocean that they do. As Ruka spends more time with Umi and Sora at the aquarium, her father and the other adults remain unaware of the children's experiences. But soon, a worrying global event comes to light - fish are mysteriously disappearing all over the world. Ruka finds herself caught up in a marine adventure with Umi and Sora as they investigate the anomaly. Their summer is filled with underwater mysteries awaiting discovery. Through this tale of friendship and the sea, Ruka's connection to the ocean deepens in unexpected ways.
